headline: Restaurants balance keeping diners and investors happy with deals
summary: Darden Restaurants (DRI) shares gained after the Olive Garden parent company reported earnings and lifted its sales outlook. The company's results come as restaurants run promotions to appeal to value-conscious consumers, like Olive Garden's never-ending pasta deal or Chili's (EAT) and Applebee's (DIN) respective value meals. Guggenheim Securities senior analyst Gregory Francfort joins Market Domination with Julie Hyman and Josh Lipton to share his outlook for the restaurant industry in 2025. "Looking back at 2024, it's been somewhat of a challenging year from a top-line perspective for restaurants, cost inflation has come down, [and] you still have labor going up," Francfort says. The analyst adds, "Food costs are much more benign than they were 12 months ago, and as we look out over the next 12 months, we expect food costs maybe ticks up a little bit [as] labor [is] kind of still sticky" and consumers spend more. He says a key challenge for restaurants right now is "having to try to balance a consumer that's pushing back a bit with also delivering a bottom line that satisfies the investor base." Watch the video above to learn more about the analyst's thoughts on Starbucks (SBUX). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here. This post was written by Naomi Buchanan.

headline: Darden Restaurants, Conagra Brands, Dollar Tree: Trending tickers
summary: Wealth host Brad Smith breaks down the latest news on Yahoo Finance's top trending tickers. Darden Restaurants (DRI) shares climbed after the company topped fiscal second quarter earnings expectations, with a strong performance from Olive Garden and LongHorn Steakhouse driving revenue and profit. The restaurant group also raised its full-year 2024 sales forecast. Conagra Brands (CAG) stock declined after the snack maker's decision to reduce its guidance. The company cited persistent inflation and challenging foreign exchange rates as key challenges. Meanwhile, Dollar Tree (DLTR) has appointed Michael Creedon as its new CEO. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Wealth here. This post was written by Angel Smith

headline: Darden’s (NYSE:DRI) Q4: Beats On Revenue, Stock Soars
summary: Restaurant company Darden (NYSE:DRI) reported Q4 CY2024 results beating Wall Street’s revenue expectations, with sales up 6% year on year to $2.89 billion. The company’s full-year revenue guidance of $12.1 billion at the midpoint came in 1.2% above analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $2.03 per share was in line with analysts’ consensus estimates.
